Title: Antoine Bethea to Host Celebrity Softball Game in San Jose
Headline: The event will take place on June 11 in the South Bay at San Jose Municipal Stadium, home of the San Francisco Giants Class A Advanced affiliate.

CustomEntity.Title: Antoine Bethea Shares His Favorite Pregame Meal

ExtendedFields.Author: rusty.parker
ExtendedFields.Description: San Francisco 49ers safety Antoine Bethea spoke with NFL Network about his work with the community, fan interaction, and his love of lasagna.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Antoine Bethea Shares His Favorite Pregame Meal

ExtendedFields.Author: rusty.parker
ExtendedFields.Description: San Francisco 49ers safety Antoine Bethea spoke with NFL Network about his work with the community, fan interaction, and his love of lasagna.

Body.Content: Throughout his decade-long NFL career, [Antoine Bethea![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/antoine-bethea/6a05f3cb-9529-420f-8edb-d4e7b6c65ff3/ "Antoine Bethea") has been known to lay the lumber on his opponents. Just ask [Dallas Cowboys wideout Dez Bryant](http://www.sbnation.com/lookit/2014/9/7/6118901/dez-bryant-hit-cowboys-49ers). Next month, Bethea will look to deliver hits of a different kind. The Niners safety is partnering with Clear Vision to host the first annual Antoine Bethea and Friends Celebrity Softball game on June 11. The event will take place in the South Bay at San Jose Municipal Stadium, home of the San Francisco Giants Class A Advanced affiliate. Gates open to the public at 1:00 p.m. with a meet-and-green on the field lasting until 1:30 p.m. A half hour later, partcipants will swing for the fences in a home run derby competition. First pitch for the game itself is scheduled for 3:15 p.m. Many of Bethea's Niners teammates will fill the rosters. Attendees include [Carlos Hyde![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/carlos-hyde/4f42b0dc-515b-4f87-a1d6-f01ad9b53825/ "Carlos Hyde"), [Ahmad Brooks![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/ahmad-brooks/f721f9db-d51e-4ab5-9b23-b1dcf7c4f12f/ "Ahmad Brooks"), [Bruce Miller![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/bruce-miller/da22438c-7658-43dd-9f2b-9e09430d144c/ "Bruce Miller"), Michael Vick, Maurice Jones-Drew and Robert Mathis ‚Äì to name a few. Tickets for the event can be purchased [online here](https://www.ticketreturn.com/prod2/BuyNew.asp?EventID=182736#.Vz3qIpMrKL7) or call (406) 297-1435. All proceeds will benefit the Second Harvest Food Bank of San Jose, Santa Clara and San Mateo. Who knows, maybe you'll be lucky enough to play on one of the teams yourself? (See tweets below) > The celebrity roster and new additions will be released each week prior to the big game June 11th! [pic.twitter.com/QxQEDD9XJH](https://t.co/QxQEDD9XJH) > ‚Äî AB Celeb ‚öæ Updates (@ABethea_SBgame) [May 4, 2016](https://twitter.com/ABethea_SBgame/status/727888161620279296)

Content.html:
This is what I'll do.... I'll pick two fans to play on each team of my Celebrity Softball Game... I'll have details shortly!!

— Antoine Bethea (@ABethea41) April 26, 2016

Title: 49ers S Antoine Bethea to Host His First Charity Softball Game
Headline: Need weekend plans? We have you covered. Here are details for the charity/sports event of the weekend.

CustomEntity.Title: Antoine Bethea Details Leadership Role with 49ers

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Antoine Bethea Details Leadership Role with 49ers

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: The 49ers safety explained how he goes about being a leader to the young players on the team's roster.

Body.Content: In need of weekend plans? [Antoine Bethea![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/antoine-bethea/6a05f3cb-9529-420f-8edb-d4e7b6c65ff3/ "Antoine Bethea") has you covered. Join the San Francisco 49ers safety and a host of his teammates at the "Antoine Bethea and Friends Celebrity Softball Game." The event is this Saturday, June 10 at San Jose Municipal Stadium. A home run derby will begin at 2 p.m. PT with the game's first pitch set to take place at 3 p.m. Members of the 49ers who will be in attendance include [Carlos Hyde![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/carlos-hyde/4f42b0dc-515b-4f87-a1d6-f01ad9b53825/ "Carlos Hyde"), [Bruce Miller![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/bruce-miller/da22438c-7658-43dd-9f2b-9e09430d144c/ "Bruce Miller"), [Jimmie Ward![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/jimmie-ward/a6e3d0d3-36c0-4e2c-b7d3-3b87e383ce65/ "Jimmie Ward"), [Eli Harold![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/eli-harold/e1328867-5ce6-4d05-baa8-8d8630b14dce/ "Eli Harold"), [Eric Reid![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/eric-reid/1e053d38-f272-41c8-9eab-d631973cdaaa/ "Eric Reid") and a number of others. Michael Vick, Maurice Jones-Drew and Robert Mathis highlight the list of non-49ers athletes who will participate. Tickets start at just $20 and can be purchased [here](https://www.ticketreturn.com/prod2/BuyNew.asp?EventID=182736#.V1ssi2Z-m0L). All proceeds will benefit Second Harvest Food Bank of San Jose.

Title: What We Learned from NaVorro Bowman's Interview with 49ers Studios
Headline: NaVorro Bowman provided a comprehensive progress report of the San Francisco 49ers offseason program on Wednesday.

CustomEntity.Title: In Studio: LB NaVorro Bowman Joins 49ers Live Set

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: The 49ers linebacker sat down with the 49ers Studios Crew to share updates on the offseason program, his thoughts on the new coaching staff and also to take on the role as fashion police.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: In Studio: LB NaVorro Bowman Joins 49ers Live Set

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: The 49ers linebacker sat down with the 49ers Studios Crew to share updates on the offseason program, his thoughts on the new coaching staff and also to take on the role as fashion police.

Body.Content: [NaVorro Bowman![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/navorro-bowman/6c460530-c18f-400f-902b-894960fe4476/ "NaVorro Bowman") provided a comprehensive progress report of the San Francisco 49ers offseason program on Wednesday. The team‚Äôs star linebacker came in studio to talk shop on the "49ers Live" set. Here are the biggest takeaways, boiled down from 19 minutes of the must-see interview above.**He‚Äôs excited about [DeForest Buckner![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/deforest-buckner/49470da5-fbc7-4d32-aa53-4d42d82a3bc5/ "DeForest Buckner")**

CustomEntity.Title: DeForest Buckner and Joshua Garnett at 49ers HQ

ExtendedFields.Author: rusty.parker
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know DeForest Buckner and Joshua Garnett in this exclusive interview with 49ers.com.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: DeForest Buckner and Joshua Garnett at 49ers HQ

ExtendedFields.Author: rusty.parker
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know DeForest Buckner and Joshua Garnett in this exclusive interview with 49ers.com.

Body.Content: Bowman admitted that he really only paid attention to the first round of the NFL Draft last week, but he did say that he was very aware of who the 49ers took with the seventh overall selection. Buckner, a 6-foot-7 mammoth of a defensive lineman, should be able to eat up blocks at the point of attack and allow Bowman to make plays. ‚ÄúI felt like that was a great pick,‚Äù Bowman said. ‚ÄúHe looks like a big guy that‚Äôs going to keep the big guys off of me. I‚Äôm glad to have him.‚Äù**He has confidence in the team‚Äôs inside linebackers** One position the 49ers didn‚Äôt address in the draft was inside linebacker. That decision to spend the team‚Äôs 11 draft choices elsewhere showed a vote of confidence in [Michael Wilhoite![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/michael-wilhoite/deb9c0c9-1040-4028-94bf-0e8b0867fe58/ "Michael Wilhoite") and [Gerald Hodges![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/gerald-hodges/4b8ed3fe-3eec-456f-998a-4efde6e6faac/ "Gerald Hodges"), two of the top candidates to start next to Bowman in 2016. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a group of smart guys, and that‚Äôs what you want,‚Äù Bowman said of his fellow inside linebackers. ‚ÄúYou want guys who can think fast in adverse times. I feel like this group is the perfect group for it. We have guys who are always willing to learn new things, no matter who the guy is. I learn new things from those guys still to this day. I‚Äôm never thinking I‚Äôm the best at anything, I just always want to continue to get better, and I think everyone‚Äôs attitude is that way.‚Äù**[Tank Carradine![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/tank-carradine/d3def88f-c81c-4f09-b871-30be0e4ed83c/ "Tank Carradine") has impressed thus far** The question, ‚ÄúWhat player has caught your eye?‚Äù elicited one of Bowman‚Äôs most interesting responses. The linebacker‚Äôs answer was Carradine, who has four sacks in his NFL career since being selected in the second round of the 2013 NFL Draft. ‚ÄúI can say he‚Äôs definitely progressed from his first year to now,‚Äù Bowman said. ‚ÄúHe knows that he has to play this year. He has to contribute in a big way. The way he came back, in shape, moving fast and embracing the move to outside linebacker has been a real eye-opener for me.‚Äù**The new coaching staff is already gaining respect of the players**

CustomEntity.Title: 49ers First-round Draft Picks Arrive in Bay Area

ExtendedFields.Author: tyler.emerick
ExtendedFields.Description: Go behind the scenes as DeForest Buckner and Joshua Garnett land in California for the first time after San Francisco made them its top two selections of the 2016 NFL Draft.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: 49ers First-round Draft Picks Arrive in Bay Area

ExtendedFields.Author: tyler.emerick
ExtendedFields.Description: Go behind the scenes as DeForest Buckner and Joshua Garnett land in California for the first time after San Francisco made them its top two selections of the 2016 NFL Draft.

Body.Content:
Bowman made it clear how he feels about the staff, noting the accountability and expectations that they bring to the table.

‚ÄúI love them,‚Äù he started. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre a great group of guys, and they‚Äôre willing to coach every single person on the team, no matter who the guy is. That‚Äôs what I want. I don‚Äôt want to be singled out. We all get coached up, and we want to get better.‚Äù
 For Bowman, it all starts with defensive coordinator Jim O‚ÄôNeil, who came to San Francisco after spending two seasons with the Cleveland Browns in the same role. 

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs going to play the best 11 guys,‚Äù Bowman said. ‚ÄúHe said that the first day, and I think that‚Äôs an eye-opener for the whole defense to come in, work and present what you have and give it your best shot. Training camp should be interesting.‚Äù

Title: San Francisco 49ers Draft Mississippi State CB Will Redmond
Headline: With the No. 68 overall pick in the 2016 NFL Draft, the San Francisco 49ers selected Mississippi State cornerback Will Redmond.

CustomEntity.Title: 49ers Draft CB Will Redmond with the No. 68 Pick

ExtendedFields.Author: joe.fann
ExtendedFields.Description: The San Francisco 49ers draft Mississippi State cornerback Will Redmond with the No. 68 pick in the 2016 NFL Draft.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: 49ers Draft CB Will Redmond with the No. 68 Pick

ExtendedFields.Author: joe.fann
ExtendedFields.Description: The San Francisco 49ers draft Mississippi State cornerback Will Redmond with the No. 68 pick in the 2016 NFL Draft.

Body.Content: With the No. 68 overall pick in the 2016 NFL Draft, the San Francisco 49ers selected Mississippi State cornerback [Will Redmond![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/will-redmond/9c6b9747-e8d0-4ba1-b01f-1b0a0bbd79a9/ "Will Redmond"). Redmond played in six games in 2015 and recorded 20 tackles, two interceptions and one pass defended. He is currently recovering from an ACL suffered during practice in October of last year. In 2014, Redmond appeared in 12 contests and tallied 51 tackles and three interceptions. General manager Trent Baalke said that Redmond was ranked even higher on their board than No. 68. Baalke added that he's confident the cornerback will be back on the football field sooner rather than later. "We had him valued higher than where we took him," Baalke said during his press conference following Day 2 of the draft. "We're very comfortable with where he's at and very comfortable that he'll be ready to go come training camp." Here is Redmond's scouting profile, courtesy of [NFL.com](http://www.49ers.com/news/article-2/San-Francisco-49ers-Draft-Stanford-G-Joshua-Garnett/e8e0fc7e-455f-4533-8b8a-18a436cf17b5): "Plus athleticism for the position. Plays with desired twitch and foot quickness. Has the physical tools to match up in tight, man coverage and mirror receiver with quality pattern recognition. Has burst to close out throws quickly and challenge the catch. Aggressive and determined in run support. Unafraid to step downhill challenge the run on his terms and near the line of scrimmage"

Title: Jimmie Ward Gets First-team CB Reps at 49ers OTAs
Headline: The versatile defensive back is backing up that description at Organized Team Activities for the San Francisco 49ers.

CustomEntity.Title: 49ers DB Jimmie Ward: 'I'm a Versatile Player'

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: Ward explained that the coaches have wanted to see him all over the field in practice. He will play anywhere "as long as he's on the field."

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: 49ers DB Jimmie Ward: 'I'm a Versatile Player'

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: Ward explained that the coaches have wanted to see him all over the field in practice. He will play anywhere "as long as he's on the field."

Body.Content: [Jimmie Ward![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/jimmie-ward/a6e3d0d3-36c0-4e2c-b7d3-3b87e383ce65/ "Jimmie Ward")‚Äôs positional location was the first of [15 notable practice observations](http://www.49ers.com/news/article-2/15-Observations-from-49ers-Opening-OTA-Session/26b159cd-5a88-41d0-8084-58e51a49dadc) at the San Francisco 49ers first Organized Team Activities session under new coach Chip Kelly. The third-year defensive back, who has previously lined up primarily as a nickel slot defender and reserve safety, instead saw action on the perimeter as the right cornerback on base downs on Tuesday. Ward was joined by [Tramaine Brock![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/tramaine-brock/b9d83814-0463-43c4-ac42-22024845457d/ "Tramaine Brock") as the team‚Äôs first-team cornerbacks. In nickel situations, Ward slid inside to his familiar role, while [Dontae Johnson![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/dontae-johnson/4b53b38e-d444-4d87-abea-928c6ace4f56/ "Dontae Johnson") assumed the perimeter responsibilities as San Francisco‚Äôs third corner. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a versatile player," Ward said following the first of nine OTA sessions this offseason. "I was drafted as a DB, so really I‚Äôm just showing how valuable I am as a player." When asked if the change was experimental, Ward explained that it's part of the spring football practice process. "There are new coaches in and they just want to see everything that I can do,‚Äù Ward said. ‚ÄúThe more you can do the better off you are. Basically, I‚Äôm getting reps everywhere, but I‚Äôm working more with the corners with the footwork to get me right.‚Äù

CustomEntity.Title: Mic'd Up Preview: NaVorro Bowman INT in 49ers OTAs

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: Watch a snippet of the upcoming Mic'D Up featuring the All-Pro San Francisco 49ers linebacker in the team's first Organized Team Activities session of the year. Full video will be released later this week.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Mic'd Up Preview: NaVorro Bowman INT in 49ers OTAs

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: Watch a snippet of the upcoming Mic'D Up featuring the All-Pro San Francisco 49ers linebacker in the team's first Organized Team Activities session of the year. Full video will be released later this week.

Body.Content: Ward, 24, added that working on the outside during OTAs will help with his press coverage and man-to-man techniques. The 5-foot-11, 193-pound defensive back made his presence known by intercepting a tipped pass during 7-on-7 work. The team's first-round draft pick from 2014 has no issues with moving to cornerback. ‚ÄúAs long as I‚Äôm on the field," he said, "I‚Äôm good.‚Äù Earlier this offseason, Ward played slot cornerback and safety at the team's pre-draft minicamp. The biggest difference in playing cornerback is the amount of running and attention to detail on technique. Ward added that there is less communication as a cornerback compared to safety, who are the ones to relay coverages across the backend of the defense. Ward sounded and looked like a player who was relishing the opportunity to do more for his team. "I think that‚Äôs exactly why I‚Äôm doing it, just to get me more reps on the field in different kinds of packages that we may run," Ward said. Because Ward made significant strides in his game a season ago, the timing to give him more responsibilities also makes sense. Ward won the [Matt Hazeltine award](http://www.49ers.com/news/article-2/San-Francisco-49ers-Announce-2015-Team-Awards/b6e5c4ba-ba96-46fe-b777-6c6c5ad25373) last year as the franchise's most courageous and inspirational defensive player. Ward played in all 16 games last season for the first time in his young NFL career. He started in eight contests and recorded 65 tackles, plus his first career sack and his first interception, which was returned for a score against the Chicago Bears. Ward said he took a lot of confidence from how he overcame a nagging foot injury as a rookie to produce his best NFL season as a sophomore. "Just being able to play elite wide receivers and actually being successful in some of those games really built (my) confidence up," he said. "Coming off my rookie year and being hurt, you kind of lose confidence. But I stayed in the film room and tried to build that back up." Now, Ward is building more confidence while running stride for stride with the likes of [Torrey Smith![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/torrey-smith/23a56c17-da51-4cdc-bb58-e00dff9b2c84/ "Torrey Smith"), [Quinton Patton![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/quinton-patton/58e6921b-95f1-4e71-9dc6-083e830d9b2a/ "Quinton Patton") and the other receivers on the 49ers roster. Ward later voiced confidence in his ability to cover perimeter wideouts around the league. Facing shifty slot receivers like Tavon Austin of the Los Angeles Rams will do that for you.

Title: Jarryd Hayne's First Season with 49ers Profiled on '60 Minutes Australia'
Headline: Jarryd Hayne did two things when he first arrived in California last year to chase his NFL dream: Book a hotel room and buy a regulation football at Target.

Content.html:
Did you miss #60Mins last night? @jarrydhayne opened up about his bid to play NFL. WATCH: https://t.co/bBw54cJQSGhttps://t.co/oVOeTVQ7JB

— 60 Minutes Australia (@60Mins) March 14, 2016

Body.PartPreview:
Did you miss #60Mins last night? @jarrydhayne opened up about his bid to play NFL. WATCH: https://t.co/bBw54cJQSGhttps://t.co/oVOeTVQ7JB

— 60 Minutes Australia (@60Mins) March 14, 2016

Body.Content: [Jarryd Hayne![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/jarryd-hayne/a67bb842-3122-4281-9628-b2e1d371a157/ "Jarryd Hayne") did two things when he first arrived in California last year to chase his NFL dream: Book a hotel room and buy a regulation football at Target. Those were just a couple of new pieces of information we learned about Hayne during a 20-minute feature aired by ‚Äú60 Minutes Australia‚Äù over the weekend. The profile took viewers behind the scenes throughout Hayne‚Äôs unprecedented journey from Australian rugby league stardom to just another rookie free agent in the NFL. The film crew followed Hayne for months to chronicle the experiment, which began with the 28-year-old turning down a $1.5 million contract with the Parramatta Eels to sign a much less lucrative deal with the San Francisco 49ers.

CustomEntity.Title: Mic'd Up: Jarryd Hayne vs. Green Bay Packers

ExtendedFields.Author: rusty.parker
ExtendedFields.Description: 49ers Studios had rookie running back Jarryd Hayne wired for sound against the Green Bay Packers in Week 4.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Mic'd Up: Jarryd Hayne vs. Green Bay Packers

ExtendedFields.Author: rusty.parker
ExtendedFields.Description: 49ers Studios had rookie running back Jarryd Hayne wired for sound against the Green Bay Packers in Week 4.

Body.Content:
Highlights of the segment included a look back at Hayne‚Äôs humble childhood in the Sydney suburb of Minto, how he rose to fame and what prompted him to give it all up to move to America.

‚ÄúI'm not normal, you know?‚Äù Hayne said. ‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs what the world thinks life is about ‚Äì to have a big house and have a nice car. But you know, for me it's about being on an adventure, finding out who you are, and pushing and growing as a person.‚Äù

Other can‚Äôt-miss moments were shots from Hayne‚Äôs going-away party in Australia and his family‚Äôs reaction to when he learned he made the 49ers 53-man roster in August. Watch the full video above, which includes interviews with his mother, agent and even one-time coach/trainer Jay Glazer.

Title: Joe Staley Discusses Personnel Along 49ers Offensive Line
Headline: Staley was asked about a broad range of topics, which included thoughts about several of his teammates.

CustomEntity.Title: OT Joe Staley Evaluates 49ers Offensive Line

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: The team's stud left guard explained how each piece along the team's o-line is progressing as the offseason program nears its end.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: OT Joe Staley Evaluates 49ers Offensive Line

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: The team's stud left guard explained how each piece along the team's o-line is progressing as the offseason program nears its end.

Body.Content: Curtis Modkins told the media last week that at this point, [Joe Staley![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/joe-staley/fa308b6d-c61d-4bbb-8e67-8ddb8dc89901/ "Joe Staley") is the only name penciled into the San Francisco 49ers starting offensive line. The team‚Äôs decade-long left tackle also spoke to reporters last week following the conclusion of OTAs. Staley was asked about a broad range of topics, which included thoughts about several of his teammates currently competing for starting jobs. Here are Staley's most notable quotes regarding San Francisco‚Äôs personnel along the offensive line. **On his growing chemistry with 49ers G [Zane Beadles![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/zane-beadles/84cf9e8c-1ee0-405c-b02c-924e494bbfce/ "Zane Beadles"): ** ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been really good. He‚Äôs a really smart guy. We expect each other to know what we‚Äôre supposed to be doing. It‚Äôs been really good. That‚Äôs one of the biggest things, playing next to a new guy, is developing the trust that we know what we‚Äôre doing. After that, it‚Äôs about how we approach blocks and combinations. That comes with practice reps.‚Äù**On his advice for 49ers rookie G [Joshua Garnett![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/joshua-garnett/61415307-2dec-4b0b-8d13-2429670f452a/ "Joshua Garnett"):**

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the San Francisco 49ers 28th overall selection in the 2016 NFL Draft.

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the San Francisco 49ers 28th overall selection in the 2016 NFL Draft.

Body.Content: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve kept in contact with him through text messages. Getting drafted in the first round, he‚Äôs obviously got physical talent. But the biggest thing coming from college is the mental game: learning the playbook and learning the speed of everything and the tempo in which we play. I think he‚Äôs done a good job this offseason, doing everything he can when he‚Äôs away from here. I‚Äôm eager to get him here.‚Äù **Note:** This year‚Äôs 28th-overall pick in the draft is currently unable to participate in the offseason program due to NFL rules regarding college graduation. Whether Garnett lines up at left guard, right guard or both will be an intriguing story line come training camp.**On rookie linemen [Fahn Cooper![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/fahn-cooper/e4ed556d-452f-4fc4-896f-541900a3957f/ "Fahn Cooper") and [John Theus![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/john-theus/e534887f-e12e-449f-aba0-0a118fcfcb30/ "John Theus"):** ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been really impressed with how quick they‚Äôve been able to pick up the playbook. The stuff we‚Äôre doing is kind of complicated compared to other years, and they‚Äôve been able to pick it up really, really well. They‚Äôre getting better every single day. It‚Äôs all about the process, going out and trying to improve. They‚Äôre asking the right questions, seeking out veterans and listening to coaching. I‚Äôm really excited with their attitude.‚Äù**On rookie [Alex Balducci![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/alex-balducci/17122569-c9db-45e5-b309-52234a4943c9/ "Alex Balducci")‚Äôs move from defensive line to offensive line:**

Body.Content: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs doing really well. I would never have known that he came from d-line. I actually didn‚Äôt know until a week after he was here. Coming from defensive line to offensive line is so different in terms of footwork. Offensive line is such a technical position. He got a lot of that stuff down Day 1. That‚Äôs a testament to his hard work and the coaching he had before he got here.‚Äù**On third-year lineman [Brandon Thomas![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/brandon-thomas/65f7d6d4-20fa-4515-9d18-200b9ebc1744/ "Brandon Thomas"):** ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs in a position right now where he only has to learn one position. Before he had been thrown all over the offensive line since he‚Äôs been here. Right now he‚Äôs at that right guard position. I think that‚Äôs been good for him. He‚Äôs been able to get good reps and good work in.‚Äù

Body.Content: Curtis Modkins told the media last week that at this point, [Joe Staley![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/joe-staley/fa308b6d-c61d-4bbb-8e67-8ddb8dc89901/ "Joe Staley") is the only name penciled into the San Francisco 49ers starting offensive line. The team‚Äôs decade-long left tackle also spoke to reporters last week following the conclusion of OTAs. Staley was asked about a broad range of topics, which included thoughts about several of his teammates currently competing for starting jobs. Here are Staley's most notable quotes regarding San Francisco‚Äôs personnel along the offensive line. **On his growing chemistry with 49ers G [Zane Beadles![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/zane-beadles/84cf9e8c-1ee0-405c-b02c-924e494bbfce/ "Zane Beadles"): ** ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been really good. He‚Äôs a really smart guy. We expect each other to know what we‚Äôre supposed to be doing. It‚Äôs been really good. That‚Äôs one of the biggest things, playing next to a new guy, is developing the trust that we know what we‚Äôre doing. After that, it‚Äôs about how we approach blocks and combinations. That comes with practice reps.‚Äù**On his advice for 49ers rookie G [Joshua Garnett![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/joshua-garnett/61415307-2dec-4b0b-8d13-2429670f452a/ "Joshua Garnett"):**

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the San Francisco 49ers 28th overall selection in the 2016 NFL Draft.

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the San Francisco 49ers 28th overall selection in the 2016 NFL Draft.

Body.Content: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve kept in contact with him through text messages. Getting drafted in the first round, he‚Äôs obviously got physical talent. But the biggest thing coming from college is the mental game: learning the playbook and learning the speed of everything and the tempo in which we play. I think he‚Äôs done a good job this offseason, doing everything he can when he‚Äôs away from here. I‚Äôm eager to get him here.‚Äù **Note:** This year‚Äôs 28th-overall pick in the draft is currently unable to participate in the offseason program due to NFL rules regarding college graduation. Whether Garnett lines up at left guard, right guard or both will be an intriguing story line come training camp.**On rookie linemen [Fahn Cooper![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/fahn-cooper/e4ed556d-452f-4fc4-896f-541900a3957f/ "Fahn Cooper") and [John Theus![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/john-theus/e534887f-e12e-449f-aba0-0a118fcfcb30/ "John Theus"):** ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been really impressed with how quick they‚Äôve been able to pick up the playbook. The stuff we‚Äôre doing is kind of complicated compared to other years, and they‚Äôve been able to pick it up really, really well. They‚Äôre getting better every single day. It‚Äôs all about the process, going out and trying to improve. They‚Äôre asking the right questions, seeking out veterans and listening to coaching. I‚Äôm really excited with their attitude.‚Äù**On rookie [Alex Balducci![](http://prod.static.49ers.clubs.nfl.com/assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/alex-balducci/17122569-c9db-45e5-b309-52234a4943c9/ "Alex Balducci")‚Äôs move from defensive line to offensive line:**

Title: Meet the 2016 Gold Rush Squad: Marissa and Yuri
Headline: Throughout the season we will introduce you to all 40 members of the 2016 Gold Rush Squad. Today meet Marissa a rookie from Castro Valley, Calif., and Yuri a third-year member from Japan.

CustomEntity.Title: Gold Rush Off The Field: More Fun Facts

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the 49ers 2016 Gold Rush squad!

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Gold Rush Off The Field: More Fun Facts

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the 49ers 2016 Gold Rush squad!

Body.Content:
*Each week, 49ers.com gets to know two members of the 49ers Gold Rush. This week, we meet Marisssa, a rookie from Castro Valley, Calif., and Yuri a third-year member from Japan.  
*  

**If you could say one thing to the 49ers fans what would it be? **

 <table width="310" cellspacing="5" cellpadding="5" border="0" align="left"> <tbody> <tr>

### **MARISSA** **MARISSA: **You can expect an exceptional game day environment every time you join us at Levi‚Äôs¬Æ Stadium this season. My teammates and I have been hard at work getting ready for opening day and we can‚Äôt wait to see and meet fans at every event and game. Bring your energy, because you know we‚Äôll have ours! **YURI: **Are you guys ready to win?!**What do you like most about being a member of the Gold Rush?YURI: **Sharing every moment, being a part of the family and smiling together with the 39 other beautiful ladies. **What have you learned from being a member of the Gold Rush?** ** MARISSA: **Being a member of the Gold Rush has taught me about the legacy of inspirational women that I am now so honored to be a part of. I have learned to be more positive, hardworking and to motivate others I am surrounded by. **How would you describe our style?YURI: **I would like to say ‚ÄòDreamer.‚Äô I moved to the United States from Japan to be a part of the Gold Rush because it‚Äôs my dream.**Can you walk us through a day in your life? MARISSA: **My day always begins with coffee. Next I spend the day teaching middle school sports, fitness, social skills and so many other activities in their P.E. class. Every so often, I run a few miles during my lunch break. After school I am an advisor for students in a hip hop dance club. Once I get home I usually work out, cook a healthy dinner and depending on the evening I may head out to either a slow pitch softball game, attend youth group as a leader for high school students, bible study or unwind at a yoga class.

### **YURI** **Do you have any pets? ** **YURI: **I have a dog, a Chihuahua named Aloha. **Who‚Äôs the most inspirational person in your life? MARISSA: **My parents have inspired me to have a hard work ethic in everything I do and have shown me a supportive and loving example to follow. **YURI: **Definitely my mom. She‚Äôs a hard worker and has a great heart. She always cares about me, she never misses my calls even if they‚Äôre at two in the morning. I want to be like my mom when I have kids in my future. **What‚Äôs something our fans would be surprised to learn about you? MARISSA: **I am a gymnast and I can walk on my hands in a handstand.
**GOLD RUSH FAVORITES**
**MARISSA** **YURI**
**MOVIE** THE LONGEST RIDE MR. BEAN
**TV SHOW** DANCING WITH THE STARS RIDICULOUSNESS
**CARTOON CHARACTER** TWEETY BIRD BARBIE
**BAY AREA RESTAURANT** LO COCO'S ITALIAN SKATES ON THE BAY

Title: 49ers S Antoine Bethea to Host His First Charity Softball Game
Headline: Need weekend plans? We have you covered. Here are details for the charity/sports event of the weekend.

CustomEntity.Title: Antoine Bethea Details Leadership Role with 49ers

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: The 49ers safety explained how he goes about being a leader to the young players on the team's roster.

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Antoine Bethea Details Leadership Role with 49ers

ExtendedFields.Author: marissa.lovus
ExtendedFields.Description: The 49ers safety explained how he goes about being a leader to the young players on the team's roster.

Body.Content: In need of weekend plans? [Antoine Bethea![](http://www.chargers.com/sites/chargers.com/files//assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/antoine-bethea/6a05f3cb-9529-420f-8edb-d4e7b6c65ff3/ "Antoine Bethea") has you covered. Join the San Francisco 49ers safety and a host of his teammates at the "Antoine Bethea and Friends Celebrity Softball Game." The event is this Saturday, June 10 at San Jose Municipal Stadium. A home run derby will begin at 2 p.m. PT with the game's first pitch set to take place at 3 p.m. Members of the 49ers who will be in attendance include [Carlos Hyde![](http://www.chargers.com/sites/chargers.com/files//assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/carlos-hyde/4f42b0dc-515b-4f87-a1d6-f01ad9b53825/ "Carlos Hyde"), [Bruce Miller![](http://www.chargers.com/sites/chargers.com/files//assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/bruce-miller/da22438c-7658-43dd-9f2b-9e09430d144c/ "Bruce Miller"), [Jimmie Ward![](http://www.chargers.com/sites/chargers.com/files//assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/jimmie-ward/a6e3d0d3-36c0-4e2c-b7d3-3b87e383ce65/ "Jimmie Ward"), [Eli Harold![](http://www.chargers.com/sites/chargers.com/files//assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/eli-harold/e1328867-5ce6-4d05-baa8-8d8630b14dce/ "Eli Harold"), [Eric Reid![](http://www.chargers.com/sites/chargers.com/files//assets/nflimg/icon-article-link.gif)](/team/roster/eric-reid/1e053d38-f272-41c8-9eab-d631973cdaaa/ "Eric Reid") and a number of others. Michael Vick, Maurice Jones-Drew and Robert Mathis highlight the list of non-49ers athletes who will participate. Tickets start at just $20 and can be purchased [here](https://www.ticketreturn.com/prod2/BuyNew.asp?EventID=182736#.V1ssi2Z-m0L). All proceeds will benefit Second Harvest Food Bank of San Jose.

Title: Five Fun Facts about Tyrell Williams
Headline: Get to know more about your favorite Los Angeles Chargers off the field, continuing with wide receiver Tyrell Williams.

Body.Content:
*This offseason, we want you to get to know our players a little more off the field.   

While you may be aware wide receiver Tyrell Williams became the 15th player in Chargers history to surpass 1,000 receiving yards, here are five fun facts you may not know about number 16.*

**First Job **‚Äì ‚ÄúMy first job was a dishwasher at The Blue Goat restaurant.‚Äù  Like many of his Chargers teammates, Williams‚Äô held his job during the summer.  ‚ÄúI hated being back in the kitchen for four hours every day.  But, it was cool because I got tips, got to play music and got free lunch every day!‚Äù

**Music Man ‚Äì **And speaking of music, Williams says his favorite artist is J. Cole.  ‚ÄúMy favorite song is probably anything off of *2014 Forest Hills Drive*.‚Äù  He also listens to Tupac, jazz and ‚Äúanything old school.‚Äù  If you‚Äôre looking for something more current, Williams recommends the new Kendrick Lamar album *DAMN.* 

**Game of Choice **‚Äì The wide receiver spends part of his off time playing video games.  His favorite is NBA 2K.  ‚ÄúI play with guys on the team but I like it because it‚Äôs a competitive thing.‚Äù

**Trusty Transportation **‚Äì ‚ÄúI still have my first car.  It‚Äôs a ‚Äô96 Pontiac Grand Prix.‚Äù  According to Williams, it has a giant Jordan sticker on the back. ‚ÄúI got it going into college and I still have it.  It has about 264,000 miles on it but it still rolls!‚Äù

**T-6 ‚Äì **When Williams first got to the Chargers, he wore number 6.  Former Charger Stevie Johnson took the undrafted rookie free agent under his wing and gave him the moniker that still has stuck to this day: ‚ÄúT-6‚Äù.

## FIND OUT MORE FIVE FUN FACTS ABOUT YOUR FAVORITE CHARGERS:

[Brandon Mebane](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/04/five-fun-facts-about-brandon-mebane)  
[Dwight Lowery](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/05/five-fun-facts-about-dwight-lowery)  
[Jatavis Brown](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/06/five-fun-facts-about-jatavis-brown)  
[Denzel Perryman](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/10/five-fun-facts-about-denzel-perryman)  
[Hunter Henry](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/11/five-fun-facts-about-hunter-henry)  
[Josh Lambo](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/12/five-fun-facts-about-josh-lambo)   
[Casey Hayward](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/18/five-fun-facts-about-casey-hayward)  
[Derek Watt](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/19/five-fun-facts-about-derek-watt)  
[Keenan Allen](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/24/five-fun-facts-about-keenan-allen)  
[Trovon Reed](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/25/five-fun-facts-about-trovon-reed)  
[Darrell Stuckey](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/04/26/five-fun-facts-about-darrell-stuckey)

Title: Max Tuerk Eager to Prove His Worth
Headline: The center is vying for a starting spot after a red-shirt rookie year in 2016.

Body.Content:
The Los Angeles Chargers‚Äô 2017[ draft class has earned rave reviews](http://www.chargers.com/news/2017/05/01/chargers-draft-grades-what-experts-have-say) from the likes of ESPN‚Äôs Mel Kiper Jr., NFL Network‚Äôs Daniel Jeremiah, MMQB‚Äôs Peter King and many more.

As with every team, some draft picks will make their presence felt immediately. Others will require additional seasoning to make an impact. 

Joey Bosa and Hunter Henry proved the former a year ago, emerging as two of the top playmakers at their respective positions.  One year later, Max Tuerk looks to follow in their footsteps.  His goal following what amounted to a red-shirt rookie year is to lock down a starting center or guard position  when the Bolts kick off the season on Monday Night Football in Denver.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm working to earn that starting job.  I want to get strong and better.  I want to keep getting my weight up.  I‚Äôm working to get better overall, but I am (focused) on getting that starting job.‚Äù

The Chargers selected Tuerk with the 66th overall pick, and immediately tempered expectations for his contributions in 2016.  After all, the center was coming off an ACL injury suffered the previous October. Even though Tuerk was able to participate as early as training camp, the Bolts knew it would take time for the athletic center to fully feel like his old self.

While you may not have seen the USC product on the field last year, rest assured he was plenty busy.  Tuerk clung to Matt Slauson‚Äôs hip pocket, soaking up everything the grizzled vet had to offer.  He got valuable practice reps while at the same time allowing his knee to fully heal.

‚ÄúLast year I wasn‚Äôt able to play at all, but I took a lot of reps in practice.  I worked hard getting back from the knee injury.  I got my body stronger and mentally prepared for the NFL. I think it helped a lot.  Being able to get stronger in the weight room, get my knee better, really study the playbook and learn from (Slauson) was important.‚Äù

Even though Tuerk sees value in his rookie year, it was difficult to go through at the time.

‚ÄúOf course I wanted to play. It was a learning experience.  Again, I look at it (now) as an opportunity to get better, which was good.‚Äù

In the coming days, Tuerk will be joined by two new rookie offensive linemen taken on day two of the draft just like he was a year ago.

So, what is his advice for Forrest Lamp and Dan Feeney?

‚ÄúJust work hard. That‚Äôs most important. Work hard. Just know there is a great support system here.  Really lean on the older guys because they will help you a lot. The veterans here are good mentors and help a lot.‚Äù

Title: Five Fun Facts about Damion Square
Headline: Get to know more about your favorite Los Angeles Chargers off the field, continuing with defensive tackle Damion Square.

ExtendedFields.Description: 161129_MicdUpSquare.mp4
161129_MicdUpSquare.mp4

Body.Content:
*This offseason, we want you to get to know our players a little more off the field.   

While you may know defensive tackle Damion Square inked a new two-year contract in March, here are five fun facts you may not know about number 71. *

1.  **Ping Pong Player**: Just like Josh Lambo, Square loves playing ping pong.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm like a table tennis champion.  It gets really intense in my house!  I go through about three tables every year.  I can break some tables when I get (ticked).‚Äù  Square said he started playing in college and wasn‚Äôt very good.  Once his wife bought him a table for their anniversary, he got hooked.   

2.  **Various Nicknames**: Square has a few nicknames but says they‚Äôre all dependent on a period in his life.  ‚ÄúWhen I was in high school, people would call me D-Sho.  If I‚Äôm in public and I hear someone say ‚ÄòHey, D-Monster!‚Äô then I know you knew me when I was really young.‚Äù  Currently, he goes by Square.  ‚ÄúI have one of those last names that becomes your nickname, but sometimes people don‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs my last name until people look it at for a while.‚Äù  

3.  **Man‚Äôs Best Friend**: Whether for protection or companionship, Square admits he will always have a dog.  ‚ÄúIt will always be a black and white American bulldog or pitbull.  I won‚Äôt go a day without a dog.‚Äù  Square gave away his last dog to a family who went through a tragedy, and that very same day, went to a shelter and picked up a similar breed.  His current dog, Brobee, is five years old.   

[https://www.instagram.com/p/BSkKHE1A0hk/](https://www.instagram.com/p/BSkKHE1A0hk/)
4.  **Enchilada Master**:  Thanks to an aunt, Square can get down in the kitchen.  ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt *like *to cook but I can cook very well.  I‚Äôm not into standing over a hot stove but I can direct a very good meal.‚Äù  If Square *is* cooking, his go-to cuisine is Mexican and Tex-Mex.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs good, fast and an easy-prep meal.‚Äù  His favorite thing to make are beef enchiladas.     

5.  **Every Tattoo Tells a Story**: Though he has a lot, Square counts his tattoos by sessions.  He thinks he‚Äôs been to the shop about seven times.  ‚ÄúEach one has significance based not on necessarily what they say, but by the period in my life.  I know what made me go to the shop to get that specific tattoo.‚Äù  He got his favorite tattoo when he was 19.  It is on his left forearm and reads ‚ÄúLove, Blood & Loyalty‚Äù.

Title: Press Conference with Philip Rivers

Body.Content:
**The Patriots defense went through a lot of changes, but they‚Äôre still pretty good and pretty active aren‚Äôt they?**
‚ÄúYeah, it‚Äôs a good group. They‚Äôve still got some of their core guys there. They‚Äôve had a few changes but all in all it‚Äôs the same scheme and they play it well. As you‚Äôve seen, they had one hiccup two weeks ago. Other than that they have been winning games which is what they‚Äôre used to doing there. So it will be as tough as it always is against those guys.‚Äù

**You guys have faced them a lot over the last couple of years. Do you call this a rivalry?**
‚ÄúI think a rivalry is when the win/loss record is kind of back and forth. They‚Äôve won the last three in a row I guess it is. We‚Äôve had some good games, some games that have had a lot of meaning to them playing with a lot at stake. This one, although it is early in the regular season, has a lot at stake for us and for both teams I think. As we‚Äôve seen, this AFC is going to be tough. There is going to be a lot of teams down the stretch and we want to be one of them. This game is going to have a big impact on that.‚Äù

**You guys have won seven in a row at night at home. Do you think playing Sunday night primetime will help out?**
‚ÄúPlaying at home for one is an advantage as we‚Äôve shown. We win at home. Our fans and our stadium, the way we play there, we obviously win. Hopefully that will be the case Sunday. Certainly we feel that there is a home field advantage at home and we‚Äôre certainly glad they‚Äôre coming to our place as opposed to us having to go back out there.‚Äù

**Any different preparation this week to try to get you guys to start off faster?**
‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt think so. Again, I don‚Äôt think there is any magic to it. We could come off the first drive offensively and go down and get three (in) thirteen plays. We would have liked to get seven there but we kind of felt like we got off to a good start last week and then we just sputtered there for a while. I think that if we prepared differently this week, then we‚Äôve been cheating ourselves the last five weeks, so I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the case. We‚Äôve got a focused group out there in practice today. I thought it was good. We‚Äôve just got to keep playing and grinding and hopefully get on a little roll.‚Äù

**Does seeing these guys again remind you of what you had to go through last January?**
‚ÄúIt certainly brings back memories, some tough ones watching the tape. Obviously we have their game film from this year but you always go back and watch how they played you in previous games. Watching that AFC Championship game was tough to watch. It brings back a lot of thoughts of plays you wish you‚Äôd have made and how you felt and all kinds of different scenarios that were going on at the time. But it‚Äôs a new game like it is every time. Every time you go out there it‚Äôs different. They‚Äôll be some different things both teams will do and hopefully we‚Äôll be the team that makes the best adjustments and comes out on top.‚Äù

**Usually you two playing each other is a battle of the AFC super powers. Would you say that this time it‚Äôs more of two teams trying to salvage their seasons?**
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs tough to say that. Those guys have only lost one game. They lost one game at home and they‚Äôve done nothing but win besides that, so it‚Äôs tough to use the word ‚Äòsalvage‚Äô for those guys. I even think that it‚Äôs hard to use that word for us but it is a big game for us, like they all are. When you find yourself 2-3 and the division leader at 4-1, certainly there‚Äôs some ground to be made up. We can‚Äôt make it up in one week but we understand what this can do for us as we move forward.‚Äù

**How are you feeling physically?**
‚ÄúI feel good. There are different weeks and days where you‚Äôre more sore than others, but I feel fine physically. I think there are a lot of guys banged up and that‚Äôs the way it is across the league. Managing that and tolerating some of it is just part of it and we‚Äôve got a lot of guys that deal with it week to week.‚Äù

**Some players and coaches have gone out of their way to talk about your performance in the AFC Championship last year. Does that matter or mean anything to you?**
‚ÄúYou certainly appreciate your peers and competitors around the league having a compliment for you. I‚Äôve always appreciated any of those remarks from last year but they only go so far and take you so far. We find ourselves 2-3 and really haven‚Äôt played well the past two games and you can throw that game out the window at this point. But certainly because you feel like you have different respect and thoughts of other guys as well for how they play the game, the way they approach it. They have a lot of those guys that know how to play it and play it well and I think that‚Äôs why they find themselves in the thick of it every year. Last year they were obviously undefeated all year. The year before that they struggled and came out here and beat us in the playoffs. They find themselves in it every year and I think it‚Äôs because of the players and they have the right kind of guys on that team.‚Äù

Title: Antonio Cromartie Transcript

Body.Content:
**On the difference is makes as a corner when the defensive line provides so much pressure:**
‚ÄúIt makes a big difference. It makes our job a whole lot easier. We can have a time clock in our head of how fast the ball is going to come out. When you apply pressure the ball comes out faster. It gives us DBs a chance to make plays on the ball‚Ä¶badly thrown balls or under thrown balls.‚Äù

**On playing better in coverage:**
‚ÄúI only got thrown at, I think, once the whole game, so I can‚Äôt say I *played*‚Ä¶I feel like these past three games I‚Äôve been playing pretty good coverage. I‚Äôve just been basically trying to work on my technique. I‚Äôm still dealing with my hip. Yesterday I felt a lot more comfortable than I ever did in the past four games. So it‚Äôs been going well with rehab and things like that.‚Äù

**On how different the Patriots looked with Cassel:**
‚ÄúWith Cassel, you can tell he‚Äôs never been in that predicament. This is his first time, I think, trailing from behind. You can tell the difference between him and Tom Brady because Brady knew what he wanted to do and things like that. He is a lot more comfortable in the pocket.‚Äù

**On defending the deep part of the field:**
‚ÄúWe went out and just played the way we were supposed to play. As a secondary we were a lot more comfortable, we communicated a lot more. That helps out a lot when you‚Äôre out there communicating, it makes things easier and everyone is on the same page.‚Äù

**On if there is a correlation between Cassel being in there and him not getting any balls thrown to his side:**
‚ÄúNo. If you look back at the playoffs, I didn‚Äôt get thrown to either back in the AFC Championship game. I don‚Äôt see anything. They came at me one when we were in a Zero Blitz. It was an overthrown ball. I was beat then, but I don‚Äôt see anything that they changed.‚Äù

**On what kind of pride he takes in knowing they shut down one of the best receivers in the league:**
‚ÄúWe just go out and do our job everyday. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre supposed to do. We feel like we have two of the best corners in the NFL playing the position and we play at a high level right now.‚Äù

**On the goal-line stand:**
‚ÄúOh, man. That felt good. I think that goal line stand took a lot out of New England. They‚Äôre down on the two-yard line and couldn‚Äôt get in the endzone. I feel that are confidence and knowing what we‚Äôre capable of doing every single week.‚Äù

**On the play that got the Patriots down to the two-yard line:**
‚ÄúThe one I got ran over on? I have to make that tackle. I‚Äôve been working hard this whole season and offseason working on tackling and it‚Äôs unfortunate I didn‚Äôt make that tackle. The defense that went in on goal line, they stood strong and we kept them out the endzone.‚Äù

**On Quentin Jammer‚Äôs performance:**
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs having a Pro Bowl performance. He‚Äôs playing like a Pro Bowler every single week. He‚Äôs a consistent corner, playing the way he‚Äôs supposed to play. You never get anything different from Jammer every single week. To me, he‚Äôs the most consistent corner that I‚Äôve ever seen since I‚Äôve been playing in the NFL, every single week, week in and week out.‚Äù

**On being leery about the very long two-game road trip:**
‚ÄúNo. I think it‚Äôs going to be fun. There‚Äôs a lot of doubters out there saying we can‚Äôt play on the road, and now it‚Äôs time to shut them up. We just have to go out there and have fun and play like we play last night. Who knows what the outcome will be?‚Äù

**On rattling Cassel:**
‚ÄúWith our front seven we feel like we can rattle any quarterback. It‚Äôs just a point of going out and doing the things we‚Äôre supposed to do and playing the way we‚Äôre supposed to play.‚Äù

**On what he‚Äôs looking forward to in London:**
‚ÄúI just want to go sight seeing. I‚Äôm going to buy a digital camera and a video camera. I just want to enjoy it. It‚Äôs my first time going to London. I just want to go over there and enjoy it with my teammates and have fun.‚Äù

**On media in London:**
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know. I‚Äôm just looking forward to going over there, period.‚Äù

**On the fans in London being neutral:**
‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs going to be exciting. I think it‚Äôs going to be like high school football, everybody is for everybody. You can‚Äôt take a game too seriously. You have to go out and have fun and enjoy it.‚Äù

Title: Darren Sproles will be on hand to kickoff Helen Woodward Animal Center‚Äôs Iams Home for the Holidays

Body.Content:
Darren Sproles will be on hand to kickoff Helen Woodward Animal Center‚Äôs Iams Home for the Holidays pet adoption drive on Tuesday, Oct. 7 at 1:30 pm at Qualcomm Stadium.   

‚ÄúMany of our area shelters and rescues will attend the event with pets that need families,‚Äù said Helen Woodward Animal center spokesperson John Van Zante. ‚ÄúChargers running back Darren Sproles will be there to encourage families to adopt their new pets. We‚Äôre proud to have Darren‚Äôs support along with the Chargers and the NFL players‚Äô union.‚Äù   

More than 3,000 animal shelters and pet rescue organizations in 17 countries worldwide, including 31 in San Diego County are joining together for the 10th annual "Iams Home 4 the Holidays" pet adoption drive.    

For more information about Iams Home for the Holidays or to locate participating shelters or rescues log on to [www.iamshome4theholidays.com](http://www.iamshome4theholidays.com/) or call (800) 421-6456.

Title: Shaun Phillips Wednesday Transcript

Body.Content:
**After all the battles with the Patriots the last couple of years, would you call this a strong rivalry?**
‚ÄúWe aren‚Äôt looking at it as a rivalry. They‚Äôre obviously a good team and we‚Äôre obviously a good team. It‚Äôs just going to be a fun game to get two good teams under the stars on Sunday Night Football in primetime. It‚Äôs going to be a shootout.‚Äù

**Does it get you more pumped up that it is primetime?**
‚ÄúDefinitely. You‚Äôre supposed to be pumped every game, but there‚Äôs nothing like it when all eyes are on you. You‚Äôre the only game on and that‚Äôs what everybody‚Äôs watching if you‚Äôre a football fan.‚Äù

**Was there anything done this week to spark a faster start Sunday?**
‚ÄúWe prepare the same way every week. We go out and have our same schedule every week like we did last year when we were (11-5). It‚Äôs the same exact way. We prepare the same way. Obviously we feel we need to start a little bit faster and we‚Äôre going to. Too bad we can‚Äôt jump all the way to Week 16. We‚Äôve got to start one week at a time and we‚Äôve got to get out and do what we need to do this week first.‚Äù

**Does the fact that it‚Äôs primetime add a little pressure?**
‚ÄúPressure? No. I was always taught that pressure makes diamonds. That‚Äôs what I‚Äôm going to continue to believe. That‚Äôs just how it is. You‚Äôve got to thrive in pressure. I look for it. Growing up, it‚Äôs something I‚Äôve always looked for and it‚Äôs something I expect. I expect to win and I expect to be good.‚Äù

**How different are they with Matt Cassel in there?**
‚ÄúThey‚Äôre a little different. I wouldn‚Äôt say a lot different because of the fact that they still have the same weapons on the outside, the same guys catching the ball, the same guys blocking, the same guys running. It‚Äôs just a different guy throwing the ball to them. Brady‚Äôs obviously one of the best quarterbacks of our generation. It‚Äôs tough without him but they‚Äôre an experienced group of guys. That‚Äôs how their system is. They can just throw another guy in there and get the job done. That‚Äôs what Cassel‚Äôs going to do. He‚Äôs going to get the job done.‚Äù

**The Patriots used a direct snap last week. What are your thoughts on defending the direct snap after what you saw last week?**
‚ÄúI thought we did an okay job. Forty-five yards isn‚Äôt too bad considering what Miami was able to do to New England. They had 100 and something. They had 45 on us in the wildcat stuff. It‚Äôs something that you obviously have to prepare for, but you don‚Äôt place your whole game plan on trying to stop two or three plays that they may or may not do. There are other things that we‚Äôve got to do, general tendencies that we have to go through that we have to prepare for first before we can just only prepare for a direct snap to a running back.‚Äù

**What has to change defensively for you guys to get back to the standard that you played at during the second half of last season?**
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre playing bad football. We‚Äôre not playing the best football, but you hold a team to 17 points, that‚Äôs usually winning football. The mindset of a defensive player is if your team has three points, you‚Äôve got to hold the other team to two. That‚Äôs how it should be. We‚Äôre not playing bad football. We‚Äôre not playing great, but there‚Äôs obviously room for improvement and we‚Äôre prepared to do whatever it takes to get where we need to go and do what we need to do to win football games.‚Äù

**Is there a sense in the locker room that this team is coming together?**
‚ÄúEvery day I feel like that. We can‚Äôt rest on our laurels of last year of, ‚ÄòWe did it last year, we can do it this year.‚Äô Every team is different around the league. Like I tell everyone, we prepare the same way every day. There‚Äôs always energy in our locker room. Guys are always fired up and guys are always ready to practice. We prepare to win football games. Unfortunately we came out on the wrong end of it, but we‚Äôre 2-3 and we have 11 more games to go. We can only start with this one. That‚Äôs the only way to get us going on the right track to see if we can do what we did last year.‚Äù

Body.Content:
*Each week, 49ers.com gets to know two members of the 49ers Gold Rush. This week, we meet Marisssa, a rookie from Castro Valley, Calif., and Yuri a third-year member from Japan.  
*  

**If you could say one thing to the 49ers fans what would it be? **

 <table width="310" cellspacing="5" cellpadding="5" border="0" align="left"> <tbody> <tr>

### **MARISSA** **MARISSA: **You can expect an exceptional game day environment every time you join us at Levi‚Äôs¬Æ Stadium this season. My teammates and I have been hard at work getting ready for opening day and we can‚Äôt wait to see and meet fans at every event and game. Bring your energy, because you know we‚Äôll have ours! **YURI: **Are you guys ready to win?!**What do you like most about being a member of the Gold Rush?YURI: **Sharing every moment, being a part of the family and smiling together with the 39 other beautiful ladies. **What have you learned from being a member of the Gold Rush?** ** MARISSA: **Being a member of the Gold Rush has taught me about the legacy of inspirational women that I am now so honored to be a part of. I have learned to be more positive, hardworking and to motivate others I am surrounded by. **How would you describe our style?YURI: **I would like to say ‚ÄòDreamer.‚Äô I moved to the United States from Japan to be a part of the Gold Rush because it‚Äôs my dream.**Can you walk us through a day in your life? MARISSA: **My day always begins with coffee. Next I spend the day teaching middle school sports, fitness, social skills and so many other activities in their P.E. class. Every so often, I run a few miles during my lunch break. After school I am an advisor for students in a hip hop dance club. Once I get home I usually work out, cook a healthy dinner and depending on the evening I may head out to either a slow pitch softball game, attend youth group as a leader for high school students, bible study or unwind at a yoga class.

### **YURI** **Do you have any pets? ** **YURI: **I have a dog, a Chihuahua named Aloha. **Who‚Äôs the most inspirational person in your life? MARISSA: **My parents have inspired me to have a hard work ethic in everything I do and have shown me a supportive and loving example to follow. **YURI: **Definitely my mom. She‚Äôs a hard worker and has a great heart. She always cares about me, she never misses my calls even if they‚Äôre at two in the morning. I want to be like my mom when I have kids in my future. **What‚Äôs something our fans would be surprised to learn about you? MARISSA: **I am a gymnast and I can walk on my hands in a handstand.
**GOLD RUSH FAVORITES**
**MARISSA** **YURI**
**MOVIE** THE LONGEST RIDE MR. BEAN
**TV SHOW** DANCING WITH THE STARS RIDICULOUSNESS
**CARTOON CHARACTER** TWEETY BIRD BARBIE

Body.Content:
Each week, 49ers.com gets to know two members of the 49ers Gold Rush. This week, we have two ladies whose names are also places! Meet Shasta, a second-year member of the squad from San Jose, Calif., and Montana, a rookie from Los Altos, Calif.  

**What's something our fans would be surprised to learn about you?**
 <table width="310" cellspacing="5" cellpadding="5" border="0" align="left"> <tbody> <tr>

### **SHASTA** **SHASTA: **I miraculously survived slipping and falling down a waterfall while hiking in Yosemite. I climbed back up to the rest of my hiking group without a scratch! You could say I‚Äôm one lucky duck. I‚Äôm more careful now, but I still love hiking and adventuring through the outdoors! **MONTANA: **I was born a 49ers faithful and was actually named after Joe Montana! My entire family loves spending quality time at 49er games while rocking our #16 jerseys together.

CustomEntity.Title: Gold Rush Off The Field: The Power of Pink

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the 49ers 2016 Gold Rush squad!

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Gold Rush Off The Field: The Power of Pink

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the 49ers 2016 Gold Rush squad!

Body.Content:
**What do you like most about being a member of the Gold Rush?**

**SHASTA: **Being a member of the Gold Rush is my prized possession. I love what I do! So my favorite part is that our season never really ends! Once football is over, we continue representing the 49ers at events and appearances, and then jump right back into auditions. We keep the 49ers fun alive year-round!

**What is your biggest goal this season?**

**MONTANA: **My biggest goal for this season is to truly live in the present and enjoy every experience that comes my way. I am constantly thinking about the future and what is in store for me, but I would like to take a step back and enjoy the season one moment at a time.

**Do you have any pets?**

**SHASTA:** I have a domestic Bengal Leopard cat named Congo! He looks like a miniature leopard but acts like a dog.

**Who is the most inspirational person in your life?**

** SHASTA: **My past and present coaches! They have each played a very significant role in mentoring me to be the very best version of myself.
 <table width="310" cellspacing="5" cellpadding="5" border="0" align="right"> <tbody> <tr>

### **MONTANA** **MONTANA: **The most inspirational person in my life is my mother. My mom has accomplished many things in her life, such as working to build schools for girls in Africa and working for other charities, and I am extremely proud to call myself her daughter. I hope to one day be like her and give back to the community in the same way she has given back. **What is your dream job?** **MONTANA: **When I was a child I always dreamed of being a teacher and now I am currently living that dream working as an elementary school teacher. I have made my dream come true and hope to continue working as a teacher and empowering the youth. My next pursuit as a side dream job would be to get my yoga teaching certification and become a yoga instructor. **Can you walk us through a day in your life?** **SHASTA: **I‚Äôm a morning person so a day in my life would start bright and early with a long run and a healthy breakfast! You can then find me working in the world of business finances. After work, I enjoy cooking a homemade meal while watching my favorite Bay Area sports teams and then I remain active in the dance studio training, practicing, and choreographing for fun! **How would you describe your style?** **MONTANA:** I would describe my style as classy comfortable because, as a teacher, I enjoy looking nice while staying comfortable enough during the day to move around and work with my students.
**GOLD RUSH FAVORITES**
**SHASTA** **MONTANA**
TV SHOW NASHVILLE FRIENDS
CHARITY HUMANE SOCIETY JUMPSTART
**HOLIDAY** CHRISTMAS CHRISTMAS
**ARTICLE OFCLOTHING** COWGIRL BOOTS YOGA PANTS

Title: Meet the 2016 Gold Rush Squad: Charlese and Melissa
Headline: Throughout the season we will introduce you to all 40 members of the 2016 Gold Rush Squad. Today meet Charlese a third-year member from San Jose, Calif. and Melissa a second-year member from San Francisco, Calif.

CustomEntity.Title: Gold Rush off the Field: Gameday Rituals

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the 49ers 2016 Gold Rush squad!

NeutralCustomEntity.Title: Gold Rush off the Field: Gameday Rituals

ExtendedFields.Author: matthew.asher
ExtendedFields.Description: Get to know the 49ers 2016 Gold Rush squad!

Body.Content:
*  
Each week, 49ers.com gets to know two members of the 49ers Gold Rush. This week, we meet third-year member Charlese from San Jose, Calif. and Melissa, a second-year member from San Francisco, Calif.*  

**If you were a tourist in San Francisco, what three things would be on your must do list? **
 <table width="310" cellspacing="5" cellpadding="5" border="0" align="left"> <tbody> <tr>

### **CHARLESE** **CHARLESE: **My to-do list includes taking the Alcatraz tour, riding a cable car, and seeing the Painted ladies. **MELISSA: ** Catch a baseball game at AT&T Park, bike/walk across the Golden Gate Bridge, and visit Twin Peaks to see the beautiful view of the city. **If you could say anything to the 49ers fans what would it be? ** **ARELI: **Mingling and taking pictures with the 49ers Faithful is the best part of being a cheerleader! I am a fan just like everyone else in the stands! Thus, it is a beautiful feeling to be able to speak with those whom share the same excitement and enthusiasm for the 49ers. I look forward to meeting you great people and connecting about our passion for the best Bay Area team! **What have you learned from being a member of the Gold Rush? ** **CHARLESE**: I have become a more goal oriented woman. My 39 Gold Rush sisters have accomplished many different goals and it inspires me to constantly better myself at work, in education, and as a friend. **What do you like most about being a member of the Gold Rush? **

### **MELISSA** **MELISSA: ** I love being a positive role model to younger girls who dream of becoming a Gold Rush member one day. Working with the Jr. Gold Rush is my favorite part of the season, and helping them overcome their fears is the most rewarding feeling. **What is your biggest fear? ** **CHARLESE: **I am terrified of spiders! **MELISSA: **Not accomplishing all my goals and dreams. I believe everyone has a purpose, and I fear not fulfilling my purpose in life. I fear waking up one day and realizing that I put my talents and skills to waste. I also have a huge fear of spiders. **Who is the most inspirational person in your life? ** ** MELISSA: **My mom for always putting her children before herself. **What is your biggest goal this season? ** **CHARLESE: **To help every rookie feel confident. Your first season can be scary because everything is new, but I want to make sure they make the best of their first year. **How would you describe your style? ** **MELISSA: ** Pretty simple and laid back. I love oversized concert t-shirts, leggings/shorts, and a pair of sneakers. **What does it mean to be a 49ers Faithful? ** **CHARLESE: ** You support the team through the good and the bad. **What is your dream job? ** **MELISSA: **I would love to be a backup dancer for Beyonce!
**GOLD RUSH FAVORITES**
**CHARLESE** **MELISSA**
MOVIE BREAKFAST AT TIFFANY'S THE TEMPTATIONS
TV SHOW KEEPING UP WITH THE KARDASHIANS BRING IT!
**HOLIDAY** THANKSGIVING THANKSGIVING
**CHARITY** LOVE YOUR MELON MAKE-A-WISH FOUNDATION
